00030 from Koo import Rpc
00031 from FieldPreferencesDialog import *
00032 from PyQt4.QtGui import *
00033 from PyQt4.QtCore import *
00034 
00035 
00036 ## @brief AbstractFieldWidget is the base class for all field widgets in Koo.
00037 # In order to create a new field widget, that is: a widget that appears in a 
00038 # auto-generated form you need to inherit from this class and implement some
00039 # of it's functions.
00040 #
00041 # The Widget handles a field from a record. You can access the record
00042 # using the property 'record' and the field name using the property 'name'.
00043 #
00044 class AbstractFieldWidget(QWidget):
00045 
00046         ## @brief Creates a new AbstractFieldWidget and receives the following parameters
00047         #  parent:     The QWidget parent of this QWidget
00048         #  view:       Holds the reference to the view the widget is in
00049         #  attributes: Holds some extra attributes such as read-only and others
00050         def __init__(self, parent, view, attributes):
00051                 QWidget.__init__(self, parent)
00052 
00053                 self.attrs = attributes
00054                 self.view = view
00055 
00056                 # Required and readonly attributes are not directly linked to
00057                 # the field states because a widget might not have a record
00058                 # assigned. Also updating the attribute directly in the fields
00059                 # can cause some problems with stateAttributes.
00060                 self._required = self.attrs.get('required', False) not in ('False', '0', False)
00061                 self._readOnly = self.attrs.get('readonly', False) not in ('False', '0', False)
00062 
00063                 self.defaultReadOnly= self._readOnly
00064                 self.defaultMenuEntries = [
00065                         (_('Set to default value'), self.setToDefault, 1),
00066                 ]
00067 
00068                 # As currently slotSetDefault needs view to be set we use it
00069                 # only in form views.
00070                 if self.view:
00071                         self.defaultMenuEntries.append( (_('Set as default value'), self.setAsDefault, 1) )
00072 
00073                 if 'stylesheet' in self.attrs:
00074                         self.setStyleSheet( self.attrs['stylesheet'] )
00075 
00076                 # self.name holds the name of the field the widget handles
00077                 self.name = self.attrs.get('name', 'unnamed')
00078                 self.record = None
00079 
00080                 # Some widgets might want to change their color set.
00081                 self.colors = {
00082                         'invalid'  : '#FF6969',
00083                         'readonly' : '#e3e3e3', 
00084                         'required' : '#ddddff', 
00085                         'normal'   : 'white'
00086                 }
00087 
00088         ## @brief Sets the default value to the field.
00089         #
00090         # Note that this requires a call to the server.
00091         def setToDefault(self):
00092                 try:
00093                         model = self.record.group.resource
00094                         res = Rpc.session.call('/object', 'execute', model, 'default_get', [self.attrs['name']])
00095                         self.record.setValue(self.name, res.get(self.name, False))
00096                         self.display()
00097                 except:
00098                         QMessageBox.warning(None, _('Operation not permited'), _('You can not set to the default value here !') )
00099                         return False
00100 
00101         ## @brief Opens the FieldPreferencesDialog to set the current value as default for this field.
00102         def setAsDefault(self):
00103                 if not self.view:
00104                         return
00105                 deps = []
00106                 wid = self.view.widgets
00107                 for wname, wview in self.view.widgets.items():
00108                         if wview.attrs.get('change_default', False):
00109                                 value = wview.record.value(wview.name)
00110                                 deps.append((wname, wname, value, value))
00111                 value = self.record.default( self.name )
00112                 model = self.record.group.resource
00113                 dialog = FieldPreferencesDialog(self.attrs['name'], self.attrs.get('string', self.attrs['name']), model, value, deps)
00114                 dialog.exec_()
00115 
00116         ## @brief Updates the background color depending on widget state.
00117         #
00118         # Possible states are: invalid, readonly, required and normal.
00119         def refresh(self):
00120                 self.setReadOnly( self._readOnly )
00121                 if self.record and not self.record.isFieldValid( self.name ):
00122                         self.setColor('invalid')
00123                 elif self._readOnly:
00124                         self.setColor('readonly')
00125                 elif self._required:
00126                         self.setColor('required')
00127                 else:
00128                         self.setColor('normal')
00129 
00130         ## @brief This function is called when the widget has to be Read-Only. 
00131         # When implementing a new widget, please use setEnabled( not ro ) instead 
00132         # of read-only. The gray color gives information to the user so she knows 
00133         # the field can't be modified
00134         def setReadOnly(self, ro):
00135                 pass
00136 
00137         ## @brief This function returns True if the field is read-only. False otherwise.
00138         def isReadOnly(self):
00139                 return self._readOnly
00140 
00141         ## @brief Use it in your widget to return the widget in which you want the color 
00142         # indicating the obligatory, normal, ... etc flags to be set. 
00143         # By default colorWidget() returns self.
00144         def colorWidget(self):
00145                 return self
00146 
00147         ## @brief Use this function to return the menuEntries your widget wants to show
00148         # just before the context menu is shown. Return a list of tuples in the form:
00149         # [ (_('Menu text'), function/slot to connect the entry, True (for enabled) or False (for disabled) )] 
00150         def menuEntries(self):
00151                 return []
00152 
00153         ## @brief Sets the background color to the widget returned by colorWidget(). 
00154         # name should contain the current state ('invalid', 'readonly', 'required' or 'normal')
00155         #
00156         # The appropiate color for each state is stored in self.colors dictionary.
00157         def setColor(self, name):
00158                 # Set the appropiate property so it can be used
00159                 # in stylesheets
00160                 self.setProperty('invalid', QVariant(False))
00161                 self.setProperty('readonly', QVariant(False))
00162                 self.setProperty('required', QVariant(False))
00163                 self.setProperty('normal', QVariant(False))
00164                 self.setProperty(name, QVariant(True))
00165 
00166                 widget = self.colorWidget()
00167                 color = QColor( self.colors.get( name, 'white' ) )
00168 
00169                 palette = QPalette()
00170                 palette.setColor(QPalette.Base, color)
00171                 widget.setPalette(palette);
00172 
00173         ## @brief Installs the eventFilter on the given widget so the popup
00174         # menu will be shown on ContextMenu event. Also data on the widget will
00175         # be stored in the record when the widget receives the FocusOut event.
00176         def installPopupMenu( self, widget ):
00177                 widget.installEventFilter( self )
00178 
00179         ## @brief Reimplements eventFilter to show the context menu and store
00180         # information when the widget loses the focus. This function will be
00181         # used on the widget you give to installPopupMenu.
00182         def eventFilter( self, target, event ):
00183                 if event.type() == QEvent.ContextMenu:
00184                         self.showPopupMenu( target, event.globalPos() )
00185                         return True
00186                 if event.type() == QEvent.FocusOut:
00187                         if self.record:
00188                                 self.store()
00189                 return False
00190 
00191         ## @brief Shows a popup menu with default and widget specific
00192         # entries.
00193         def showPopupMenu(self, parent, position):
00194                 entries = self.defaultMenuEntries[:]
00195                 new = self.menuEntries()
00196                 if len(new) > 0:
00197                         entries = entries + [(None, None, None)] + new
00198                 menu = QMenu( parent )
00199                 for title, slot, enabled in entries:
00200                         if title:
00201                                 item = QAction( title, menu )
00202                                 if slot:
00203                                         self.connect( item, SIGNAL("triggered()"), slot )
00204                                 item.setEnabled( enabled )
00205                                 menu.addAction( item )
00206                         else:
00207                                 menu.addSeparator()
00208                 menu.popup( position )
00209 
00210         ## @brief Call this function/slot when your widget changes the
00211         # value. This is needed for the onchange option in the 
00212         # server modules. Usually you'll call it on lostFocus if
00213         # there's a TextBox or on selection, etc.
00214         def modified(self):
00215                 if not self.record:
00216                         return 
00217                 self.store()
00218 
00219         ## @brief Override this function. This will be called by display()
00220         # when it wants the value to be shown in the widget
00221         def showValue(self):
00222                 pass
00223 
00224         ## @brief Override this function. It will be used whenever there
00225         # is no model or have created a new record.
00226         def clear(self):
00227                 pass
00228 
00229         ## @brief This function displays the current value of the field in the record 
00230         # in the widget.
00231         #
00232         # Do not reimplement this function, override clear() and showValue() instead
00233         def display(self):
00234                 if not self.record:
00235                         self._readOnly = True
00236                         self.clear()
00237                         self.refresh()
00238                         return
00239                 self._readOnly = self.record.isFieldReadOnly(self.name)
00240                 self._required = self.record.isFieldRequired(self.name)
00241                 self.refresh()
00242                 self.showValue()
00243         
00244         def reset(self):
00245                 self.refresh()
00246 
00247         ## @brief Sets the current record for the widget.
00248         def load(self, record ):
00249                 self.record = record
00250                 self.display()
00251 
00252         ## @brief Stores information in the widget to the record.
00253         # Reimplement this function in your widget.
00254         def store(self):
00255                 pass
